javadoc:
This interface provides all the methods needed to create,delete, retrieve,
 modify code level constructs (CodeUnits, Macros, Fragments, and Modules).

methods.name: getCodeUnitAt
methods.comment: get the code unit that starts at the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to look for a codeUnit.

return.comment: the codeUnit that begins at the given address

methods.name: getCodeUnitContaining
methods.comment: get the code unit that contains the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to look for a codeUnit.

return.comment: the codeUnit that contains the given address

methods.name: getCodeUnitAfter
methods.comment:
get the next code unit that starts an an address that is greater than the
 given address. The search will include instructions, defined data, and
 undefined data.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address from which to search forward.

return.comment:
the next CodeUnit found while searching forward from addr or null
         if none found.

methods.name: getCodeUnitBefore
methods.comment:
get the next code unit that starts at an address that is less than the
 given address. The search will include instructions, defined data, and
 undefined data.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address from which to search backwards.

return.comment:
The first codeUnit found while searching backwards from addr or
         null if none found.

methods.name: getCodeUnitIterator
methods.comment:
Get an iterator that contains all code units in the program which have
 the specified property type defined. Standard property types are defined
 in the CodeUnit class. The property types are: EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT,
 POST_COMMENT, USER_REFERENCE, MNEMONIC_REFERENCE, VALUE_REFERENCE.
 Property types can also be user defined.

params.name: property
params.comment: the name of the property type.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a CodeUnitIterator that returns all code units from the indicated
         start address that have the specified property type defined.

methods.javadoc:
Get an iterator that contains the code units which have the specified
 property type defined. Only code units at an address greater than or
 equal to the specified start address will be returned by the iterator. If
 the start address is null then check the entire program. Standard
 property types are defined in the CodeUnit class. The property types are:
 EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT, POST_COMMENT, USER_REFERENCE,
 MNEMONIC_REFERENCE, VALUE_REFERENCE. Property types can also be user
 defined.
@param property the name of the property type. (EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT,
            POST_COMMENT, USER_REFERENCE, MNEMONIC_REFERENCE,
            VALUE_REFERENCE)
@param addr the start address
@param forward true means get iterator in forward direction
@return a CodeUnitIterator that returns all code units from the indicated
         start address that have the specified property type defined.
methods.name: getCodeUnitIterator
methods.comment:
Get an iterator that contains the code units which have the specified
 property type defined. Only code units at an address greater than or
 equal to the specified start address will be returned by the iterator. If
 the start address is null then check the entire program. Standard
 property types are defined in the CodeUnit class. The property types are:
 EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT, POST_COMMENT, USER_REFERENCE,
 MNEMONIC_REFERENCE, VALUE_REFERENCE. Property types can also be user
 defined.

params.name: property
params.comment:
the name of the property type. (EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT,
            POST_COMMENT, USER_REFERENCE, MNEMONIC_REFERENCE,
            VALUE_REFERENCE)

params.name: addr
params.comment: the start address

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a CodeUnitIterator that returns all code units from the indicated
         start address that have the specified property type defined.

methods.name: getCodeUnitIterator
methods.comment:
Get an iterator that contains the code units which have the specified
 property type defined. Only code units starting within the address set
 will be returned by the iterator. If the address set is null then check
 the entire program. Standard property types are defined in the CodeUnit
 class.

params.name: property
params.comment: the name of the property type.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address set

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a CodeUnitIterator that returns all code units from the indicated
         address set that have the specified property type defined.

methods.name: getCommentCodeUnitIterator
methods.comment:
Get a forward code unit iterator over code units that have the specified
 comment type.

params.name: commentType
params.comment: type defined in CodeUnit

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: address set

return.comment:
a CodeUnitIterator that returns all code units from the indicated
         address set that have the specified comment type defined

methods.name: getCommentAddressIterator
methods.comment:
Get a forward iterator over addresses that have the specified comment
 type.

params.name: commentType
params.comment: type defined in CodeUnit

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: address set

params.name: forward
params.comment:
true to iterator from lowest address to highest, false
            highest to lowest

return.comment:
an AddressIterator that returns all addresses from the indicated
         address set that have the specified comment type defined

methods.name: getCommentAddressIterator
methods.comment: Get a forward iterator over addresses that have any type of comment.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: address set

params.name: forward
params.comment:
true to iterator from lowest address to highest, false
            highest to lowest

return.comment:
an AddressIterator that returns all addresses from the indicated
         address set that have any type of comment.

methods.name: getComment
methods.comment: Get the comment for the given type at the specified address.

params.name: commentType
params.comment:
either EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT, POST_COMMENT,
            PLATE_COMMENT, or REPEATABLE_COMMENT

params.name: address
params.comment: the address of the comment.

return.comment:
the comment string of the appropriate type or null if no comment
         of that type exists for this codeunit

methods.name: setComment
methods.comment: Set the comment for the given comment type at the specified address.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address of the comment.

params.name: commentType
params.comment:
either EOL_COMMENT, PRE_COMMENT, POST_COMMENT,
            PLATE_COMMENT, or REPEATABLE_COMMENT

params.name: comment
params.comment: comment to set at the address

methods.name: getCodeUnits
methods.comment: get a CodeUnit iterator that will iterate over the entire address space.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment: a CodeUnitIterator in forward direction

methods.name: getCodeUnits
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator of the code units in this listing (in proper
 sequence), starting at the specified address. The specified address
 indicates the first code unit that would be returned by an initial call
 to the next method. An initial call to the previous
 method would return the code unit with an address less than the specified
 address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the start address of the iterator.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment: a CodeUnitIterator positioned just before addr.

methods.name: getCodeUnits
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over the address range(s). Only code units whose start
 addresses are contained in the given address set will be returned by the
 iterator.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the AddressRangeSet to iterate over.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a CodeUnitIterator that is restricted to the give
         AddressRangeSet.

methods.name: getInstructionAt
methods.comment:
get the Instruction that starts at the given address. If no Instruction
 has been defined to start at that address, return null.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to check for the start of an instruction

return.comment:
the Instruction object that starts at addr; or null if no
         Instructions starts at addr.

methods.name: getInstructionContaining
methods.comment:
get the Instruction that contains the given address. If an Instruction is
 defined that contains that address, it will be returned. Otherwise, null
 will be returned.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to check for containment in an Instruction.

return.comment:
the Instruction object that contains addr; or null if no
         Instructions contain addr.

methods.name: getInstructionAfter
methods.comment:
get the closest Instruction that starts at an address that is greater
 than the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address at which to begin the forward search.

return.comment: the next Instruction whose starting address is greater than addr.

methods.name: getInstructionBefore
methods.comment:
get the closest Instruction that starts at an address that is less than
 the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address at which to begin the backward search.

return.comment: the closest Instruction whose starting address is less than addr.

methods.name: getInstructions
methods.comment:
get an Instruction iterator that will iterate over the entire address
 space.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
an InstructionIterator that iterates over all instructions in the
         program.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator of the instructions in this listing (in proper sequence), starting at the specified address. The specified address indicates the first instruction that would be returned by an initial call to the next method. An initial call to the previous method would return the instruction with an address less than the specified address.

@param addr the initial position of the iterator @param forward true means get iterator in forward direction @return an InstructionIterator that iterates over all Instruction objects in the given address range set.
methods.name: getInstructions
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator of the instructions in this listing (in proper
 sequence), starting at the specified address. The specified address
 indicates the first instruction that would be returned by an initial call
 to the next method. An initial call to the previous
 method would return the instruction with an address less than the
 specified address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the initial position of the iterator

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
an InstructionIterator that iterates over all Instruction objects
         in the given address range set.

methods.name: getInstructions
methods.comment:
Get an Instruction iterator over the address range(s). Only instructions
 whose start addresses are contained in the given address set will be
 returned by the iterator.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address range set to iterate over.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined and undefined Data
         objects in the given address range set.

methods.name: getDataAt
methods.comment: get the Data (Defined or Undefined) that starts at the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to check for a Data object.

return.comment:
the Data object that starts at addr; or null if no Data
         objects(defined or undefined) start at addr.

methods.name: getDataContaining
methods.comment:
Gets the data object that is at or contains the given address or null if
 the address in not in memory or is in an instruction.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for which to find its containing data element.

return.comment:
the Data object containing the given address or null if there is
         no data that contains the address.

methods.name: getDataAfter
methods.comment:
get the closest Data object that starts at an address that is greater
 than the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to begin the forward search.

return.comment: the next Data object whose starting address is greater than addr.

methods.name: getDataBefore
methods.comment:
get the closest Data object that starts at an address that is less than
 the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address at which to begin the backward search.

return.comment: the closest Data object whose starting address is less than addr.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment:
get a Data iterator that will iterate over the entire address space;
 returning both defined and undefined Data objects.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined and undefined Data
         object in the program.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator of the data in this listing (in proper sequence),
 starting at the specified address. The specified address indicates the
 first Data that would be returned by an initial call to the next
 method. An initial call to the previous method would return the
 Data with an address less than the specified address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the initial position of the iterator

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all Data objects in the given
         address range set.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over the address range(s). Only data whose start
 addresses are contained in the given address set will be returned by the
 iterator.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address range set to iterate over.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined and undefined Data
         objects in the given address range set.

methods.name: getDefinedDataAt
methods.comment:
get the Data (defined) object that starts at the given address. If no
 Data object is defined at that address, then return null.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address to check for defined Data.

return.comment:
a Data object that starts at addr, or null if no Data object has
         been defined to start at addr.

methods.name: getDefinedDataContaining
methods.comment:
get the Data object that starts at the given address. If no Data objects
 have been defined that contain that address, then return null.

params.name: addr
params.comment:
the address to check for containment in a defined Data
            object.

return.comment: the defined Data object containing addr.

methods.name: getDefinedDataAfter
methods.comment:
get the defined Data object that starts at an address that is greater
 than the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to begin the forward search.

return.comment:
the next defined Data object whose starting address is greater
         than addr.

methods.name: getDefinedDataBefore
methods.comment:
get the closest defined Data object that starts at an address that is
 less than the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address at which to begin the backward search.

return.comment:
the closest defined Data object whose starting address is less
         than addr.

methods.name: getDefinedData
methods.comment:
get a Data iterator that will iterate over the entire address space;
 returning only defined Data objects.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined Data objects in the
         program.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator of the defined data in this listing (in proper sequence), starting at the specified address. The specified address indicates the first defined Data that would be returned by an initial call to the next method. An initial call to the previous method would return the defined Data with an address less than the specified address.

@param addr the initial position of the iterator @param forward true means get iterator in forward direction @return a DataIterator that iterates over all defined Data objects in the given address range set.
methods.name: getDefinedData
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator of the defined data in this listing (in proper
 sequence), starting at the specified address. The specified address
 indicates the first defined Data that would be returned by an initial
 call to the next method. An initial call to the
 previous method would return the defined Data with an address
 less than the specified address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the initial position of the iterator

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined Data objects in the
         given address range set.

methods.name: getDefinedData
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over the address range(s). Only defined data whose start
 addresses are contained in the given address set will be returned by the
 iterator.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address range set to iterate over.

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
a DataIterator that iterates over all defined Data objects in the
         given address range set.

methods.name: getUndefinedDataAt
methods.comment: get the Data (undefined) object that starts at the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address to check for undefined data.

return.comment:
a default DataObject if bytes exist at addr and nothing has been
         defined to exist there. Otherwise returns null.

methods.name: getUndefinedDataAfter
methods.comment:
Get the undefined Data object that starts at an address that is greater
 than the given address. This operation can be slow for large programs so
 a TaskMonitor is required.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to begin the forward search.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: a task monitor allowing this operation to be cancelled

return.comment:
the next undefined Data object whose starting address is greater
         than addr.

methods.name: getFirstUndefinedData
methods.comment:
Get the undefined Data object that falls within the set. This operation
 can be slow for large programs so a TaskMonitor is required.

params.name: set
params.comment: the addressSet at which to find the first undefined address.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: a task monitor allowing this operation to be cancelled

return.comment:
the next undefined Data object whose starting address falls
         within the addresSet.

methods.name: getUndefinedDataBefore
methods.comment:
get the closest undefined Data object that starts at an address that is
 less than the given address. This operation can be slow for large
 programs so a TaskMonitor is required.

params.name: addr
params.comment: The address at which to begin the backward search.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: a task monitor allowing this operation to be cancelled

return.comment:
the closest undefined Data object whose starting address is less
         than addr.

methods.name: getUndefinedRanges
methods.comment:
Get the address set which corresponds to all undefined code units within
 the specified set of address.

params.name: set
params.comment: set of addresses to search

params.name: initializedMemoryOnly
params.comment:
if true set will be constrained to
            initialized memory areas, if false set will be constrained to
            all defined memory blocks.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor

return.comment: address set corresponding to undefined code units

methods.name: getDefinedCodeUnitAfter
methods.comment: Returns the next instruction or defined data after the given address;

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to begin the search

return.comment:
the next instruction or defined data at an address higher than
         the given address.

methods.name: getDefinedCodeUnitBefore
methods.comment:
Returns the closest instruction or defined data that starts before the
 given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to begin the search

return.comment:
the closest instruction or defined data at an address below the
         given address.

methods.name: getCompositeData
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over all the composite data objects (Arrays, Structures,
 and Union) in the program.

params.name: forward
params.comment:
true means get iterator that starts at the minimum address
            and iterates forward. Otherwise it starts at the maximum
            address and iterates backwards.

return.comment: an iterator over all the composite data objects.

methods.name: getCompositeData
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over all the composite data objects (Arrays, Structures,
 and Union) in the program at or after the given Address.

params.name: start
params.comment: start of the iterator

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
an iterator over all the composite data objects starting with the
         given address.

methods.name: getCompositeData
methods.comment:
Get an iterator over all the composite data objects (Arrays, Structures,
 and Union) within the specified address set in the program.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address set

params.name: forward
params.comment: true means get iterator in forward direction

return.comment:
an iterator over all the composite data objects in the given
         address set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over all user defined property names.
@return an iterator over all user defined property names.
methods.name: getUserDefinedProperties
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all user defined property names.

return.comment: an iterator over all user defined property names.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the entire property from the program
@param propertyName the name of the property to remove.
methods.name: removeUserDefinedProperty
methods.comment: Removes the entire property from the program

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: the name of the property to remove.

methods.name: getPropertyMap
methods.comment: Returns the PropertyMap associated with the given name

params.name: propertyName
params.comment: the property name

return.comment: PropertyMap the propertyMap object.

methods.name: createInstruction
methods.comment:
Creates a new Instruction object at the given address. The specified
 context is only used to create the associated prototype. It is critical
 that the context be written immediately after creation of the instruction
 and must be done with a single set operation on the program context. Once
 a set context is done on the instruction address, any subsequent context
 changes will result in a ContextChangeException

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to create an instruction

params.name: prototype
params.comment:
the InstructionPrototype the describes the type of
            instruction to create.

params.name: memBuf
params.comment:
buffer that provides the bytes that make up the
            instruction.

params.name: context
params.comment: the processor context at this location.

return.comment: the newly created instruction.

methods.name: addInstructions
methods.comment:
Creates a complete set of instructions. A preliminary pass will be made
 checking for code unit conflicts which will be marked within the
 instructionSet causing dependent blocks to get pruned.

params.name: instructionSet
params.comment:
the set of instructions to be added. All code unit
            conflicts will be marked within the instructionSet and
            associated blocks.

params.name: overwrite
params.comment: if true, overwrites existing code units.

throws.comment:
if the instruction set is incompatible
             with the program memory

return.comment:
the set of addresses over which instructions were actually added
         to the program. This may differ from the InstructionSet address
         set if conflict errors occurred. Such conflict errors will be
         recorded within the InstructionSet and its InstructionBlocks.

methods.name: createData
methods.comment:
Creates a new defined Data object of a given length at the given address.
 This ignores the bytes that are present

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to create a new Data object.

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
the Data Type that describes the type of Data object to
            create.

params.name: length
params.comment: the length of the datatype.

throws.comment:
if the given datatype conflicts (same
             name, but not equal) with an existing datatype.

return.comment: newly created data unit

methods.name: createData
methods.comment:
Creates a new defined Data object at the given address. This ignores the
 bytes that are present

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to create a new Data object.

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
the Data Type that describes the type of Data object to
            create.

throws.comment:
if the given datatype conflicts (same
             name, but not equal) with an existing datatype.

return.comment: newly created data unit

methods.name: clearCodeUnits
methods.comment:
Clears any code units in the given range returning everything to "db"s,
 and removing any references in the affected area. Note that the module
 and fragment structure is unaffected. If part of a code unit is contained
 in the given address range then the whole code unit will be cleared.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the start address of the area to be cleared.

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the end address of the area to be cleared.

params.name: clearContext
params.comment: clear context register values if true

methods.name: clearCodeUnits
methods.comment:
Clears any code units in the given range returning everything to "db"s,
 and removing any references in the affected area. Note that the module
 and fragment structure is unaffected. If part of a code unit is contained
 in the given address range then the whole code unit will be cleared.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the start address of the area to be cleared.

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the end address of the area to be cleared.

params.name: clearContext
params.comment: clear context register values if true

params.name: monitor
params.comment: monitor that can be used to cancel the clear operation

methods.name: isUndefined
methods.comment: Checks if the given ranges consists entirely of undefined data.

params.name: start
params.comment: The start address of the range to check.

params.name: end
params.comment: The end address of the range to check.

return.comment:
boolean true if the given range is in memory and has no
         instructions or defined data.

methods.name: clearComments
methods.comment: Clears the comments in the given range.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the start address of the range to be cleared

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the end address of the range to be cleard

methods.name: clearProperties
methods.comment: Clears the properties in the given range.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the start address of the range to be cleared

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the end address of the range to be cleard

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor for cancelling operation.

methods.name: clearAll
methods.comment:
Removes all CodeUnits, comments, properties, and references from the
 listing.

params.name: clearContext
params.comment:
if true, also clear any instruction context that has
            been laid down from previous disassembly.

params.name: monitor
params.comment:
used for tracking progress and cancelling the clear
            operation.

methods.name: getFragment
methods.comment: Returns the fragment containing the given address.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: name of the tree to search

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address that is contained within a fragment.

return.comment: will return null if the address is not in the program.

methods.name: getModule
methods.comment: Returns the module with the given name.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: name of the tree to search

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the module to find.

return.comment: will return null if there is no module with the given name.

methods.name: getFragment
methods.comment: Returns the fragment with the given name.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: name of the tree to search

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the fragment to find.

return.comment: will return null if there is no fragment with the given name.

methods.name: createRootModule
methods.comment:
Create a new tree that will be identified by the given name. By default,
 the new root module is populated with fragments based on memory blocks.
 Note that the root module's name is not the same as its tree name. The
 root module name defaults to the name of the program.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: name of the tree to search

throws.comment:
if a tree with the given name already
             exists

return.comment: root module

methods.name: getRootModule
methods.comment: Gets the root module for a tree in this listing.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: name of tree

return.comment:
the root module for the listing; returns null if there is no tree
         rooted at a module with the given name.

methods.name: getRootModule
methods.comment: Returns the root module of the program tree with the given name;

params.name: treeID
params.comment: id of the program tree

return.comment: the root module of the specified tree.

methods.name: getDefaultRootModule
methods.comment:
Returns the root module for the default program tree. This would be the
 program tree that has existed the longest.

return.comment: the root module for the oldest existing program tree.

methods.javadoc:
Get the names of all the trees defined in this listing.
@return the names of all program trees defined in the program.
methods.name: getTreeNames
methods.comment: Get the names of all the trees defined in this listing.

return.comment: the names of all program trees defined in the program.

methods.name: removeTree
methods.comment: Remove the tree rooted at the given name.

params.name: treeName
params.comment: the name of the tree to remove.

return.comment:
true if the tree was removed; return false if this is the last
         tree for the program; cannot delete the last tree.

methods.name: renameTree
methods.comment:
Rename the tree. This method does not change the root module's name only
 the identifier for the tree.

params.name: oldName
params.comment: old name of the tree

params.name: newName
params.comment: new name of the tree.

throws.comment:
if newName already exists for a root
             module

methods.name: getNumCodeUnits
methods.comment:
gets the total number of CodeUnits (Instructions, defined Data, and
 undefined Data)

return.comment: the total number of CodeUnits in the listing.

methods.javadoc:
gets the total number of defined Data objects in the listing.
@return the total number of defined Data objects in the listing.
methods.name: getNumDefinedData
methods.comment: gets the total number of defined Data objects in the listing.

return.comment: the total number of defined Data objects in the listing.

methods.javadoc:
gets the total number of Instructions in the listing.
@return number of Instructions
methods.name: getNumInstructions
methods.comment: gets the total number of Instructions in the listing.

return.comment: number of Instructions

methods.javadoc:
Get the data type manager for the program.
@return the datatype manager for the program.
methods.name: getDataTypeManager
methods.comment: Get the data type manager for the program.

return.comment: the datatype manager for the program.

methods.name: createFunction
methods.comment: Create a function with an entry point and a body of addresses.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the function to create

params.name: entryPoint
params.comment: the entry point for the function

params.name: body
params.comment: the address set that makes up the functions body

params.name: source
params.comment: the source of this function

throws.comment: if the name contains invalid characters

if the given body overlaps with an
             existing function.

return.comment: the created function

methods.name: createFunction
methods.comment:
Create a function in the specified namespace with an entry point and a
 body of addresses.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the function to create

params.name: nameSpace
params.comment: the namespace in which to create the function

params.name: entryPoint
params.comment: the entry point for the function

params.name: body
params.comment: the address set that makes up the functions body

params.name: source
params.comment: the source of this function

throws.comment: if the name contains invalid characters

if the given body overlaps with an
             existing function.

return.comment: the created function

methods.javadoc:
Remove a function a given entry point.
@param entryPoint entry point of function to be removed.
methods.name: removeFunction
methods.comment: Remove a function a given entry point.

params.name: entryPoint
params.comment: entry point of function to be removed.

methods.name: getFunctionAt
methods.comment: Get a function with a given entry point.

params.name: entryPoint
params.comment: entry point of the function

return.comment: function at the entry point

methods.name: getGlobalFunctions
methods.comment: Returns a list of all global functions with the given name.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the functions to retrieve.

return.comment: a list of all global functions with the given name.

methods.name: getFunctions
methods.comment:
Returns a list of all functions with the given name in the given
 namespace.

params.name: namespace
params.comment:
the namespace to search for functions of the given name.
            Can be null, in which case it will search the global
            namespace.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the functions to retrieve.

return.comment: a list of all global functions with the given name.

methods.name: getFunctionContaining
methods.comment: Get a function containing an address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to search.

return.comment: function containing this address, null otherwise

methods.javadoc:
Get an iterator over all external functions
@return an iterator over all currently defined external functions.
methods.name: getExternalFunctions
methods.comment: Get an iterator over all external functions

return.comment: an iterator over all currently defined external functions.

methods.name: getFunctions
methods.comment: Get an iterator over all functions

params.name: forward
params.comment:
if true functions are return in address order, otherwise
            backwards address order

return.comment: an iterator over all currently defined functions.

methods.name: getFunctions
methods.comment: Get an iterator over all functions starting at address

params.name: start
params.comment: the address to start iterating at.

params.name: forward
params.comment:
if true functions are return in address order, otherwise
            backwards address order

return.comment: an iterator over functions

methods.name: getFunctions
methods.comment: Get an iterator over all functions with entry points in the address set.

params.name: asv
params.comment: the set of addresses to iterator function entry points over.

params.name: forward
params.comment:
if true functions are return in address order, otherwise
            backwards address order

return.comment: an iterator over functions

methods.name: isInFunction
methods.comment: Check if an address is contained in a function

params.name: addr
params.comment: address to test

return.comment: true if this address is in one or more functions

methods.name: getCommentHistory
methods.comment: Get the comment history for comments at the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: address for comments

params.name: commentType
params.comment: comment type defined in CodeUnit

return.comment: array of comment history records

name: Listing
comment:
This interface provides all the methods needed to create,delete, retrieve,
 modify code level constructs (CodeUnits, Macros, Fragments, and Modules).
